body_html: @cpuhrsch I am afraid not. The function called by the code generates several Bernoulli distributed random numbers with a single probability p. Actually, the important OP like dropout calls the bernoulli which takes a double type as the parameter.
body_text: @cpuhrsch  I am afraid not. The function called by  the code generates several Bernoulli distributed random numbers with a single probability p.  Actually, the important OP like dropout calls the bernoulli which takes a double type as the parameter.
body: @cpuhrsch  I am afraid not. The function called by [ the code](https://github.com/intel/pytorch/blob/bernoulli/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorRandom.cpp#L100) generates several Bernoulli distributed random numbers with a single probability p.  Actually, the important OP like dropout calls the bernoulli which takes a double type as the parameter.
